$comment: OSCAL Assessment Plan Model: JSON Schema

oscal-ap-part.title: Part
oscal-ap-part.description: A partition of a control's definition or a child of another part.

id.title: Part Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for a specific part instance. This identifier's uniqueness is document scoped and is intended to be consistent for the same part across minor revisions of the document.

name.title: Part Name
name.description: A textual label that uniquely identifies the part's semantic type.

ns.title: Part Namespace
ns.description: A namespace qualifying the part's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

class.title: Part Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the part's name. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of multiple parts of the same control with the same name and ns.

title.title: Part Title
title.description: A name given to the part, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

prose.title: Part Text
prose.description: Permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

oscal-ap-metadata.title: Publication metadata
oscal-ap-metadata.description: Provides information about the publication and availability of the containing document.

title.title: Document Title
title.description: A name given to the document, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-revision.title: Revision History Entry
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-revision.description: An entry in a sequential list of revisions to the containing document in reverse chronological order (i.e., most recent previous revision first).

title.title: Document Title
title.description: A name given to the document revision, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

oscal-ap-location.title: Location
oscal-ap-location.description: A location, with associated metadata that can be referenced.

uuid.title: Location Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier that can be used to reference this defined location elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistantly used for a given location across revisions of the document.

title.title: Location Title
title.description: A name given to the location, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

items.title: Location URL
items.description: The uniform resource locator (URL) for a web site or Internet presence associated with the location.

oscal-ap-location-uuid.title: Location Reference
oscal-ap-location-uuid.description: References a location defined in metadata.

oscal-ap-party.title: Party (organization or person)
oscal-ap-party.description: A responsible entity which is either a person or an organization.

uuid.title: Party Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier that can be used to reference this defined location elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistantly used for a given party across revisions of the document.

type.title: Party Type
type.description: A category describing the kind of party the object describes.

name.title: Party Name
name.description: The full name of the party. This is typically the legal name associated with the party.

short-name.title: Party Short Name
short-name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the party.

items.title: Party External Identifier
items.description: An identifier for a person or organization using a designated scheme. e.g. an Open Researcher and Contributor ID (ORCID)

scheme.title: External Identifier Schema
scheme.description: Indicates the type of external identifier.

items.title: Organizational Affiliation
items.description: Identifies that the party object is a member of the organization associated with the provided UUID.

oscal-ap-party-uuid.title: Party Reference
oscal-ap-party-uuid.description: References a party defined in metadata.

oscal-ap-role.title: Role
oscal-ap-role.description: Defines a function assumed or expected to be assumed by a party in a specific situation.

id.title: Role Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for a specific role instance. This identifier's uniqueness is document scoped and is intended to be consistent for the same role across minor revisions of the document.

title.title: Role Title
title.description: A name given to the role, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

short-name.title: Role Short Name
short-name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the role.

description.title: Role Description
description.description: A summary of the role's purpose and associated responsibilities.

oscal-ap-role-id.title: Role Identifier Reference
oscal-ap-role-id.description: A reference to the roles served by the user.

oscal-ap-back-matter.title: Back matter
oscal-ap-back-matter.description: A collection of resources, which may be included directly or by reference.

items.title: Resource
items.description: A resource associated with content in the containing document. A resource may be directly included in the document base64 encoded or may point to one or more equavalent internet resources.

uuid.title: Resource Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this defined resource elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistantly used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

title.title: Resource Title
title.description: A name given to the resource, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

description.title: Resource Description
description.description: A short summary of the resource used to indicate the purpose of the resource.

citation.title: Citation
citation.description: A citation consisting of end note text and optional structured bibliographic data.

biblio.title: Bibliographic Definition
biblio.description: A container for structured bibliographic information. The model of this information is undefined by OSCAL.

items.title: Resource link
items.description: A pointer to an external resource with an optional hash for verification and change detection.

href.title: Hypertext Reference
href.description: A resolvable URI reference to a resource.

media-type.title: Media Type
media-type.description: Specifies a media type as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) Media Types Registry.

base64.title: Base64
base64.description: The Base64 alphabet in RFC 2045 - aligned with XSD.

filename.title: File Name
filename.description: Name of the file before it was encoded as Base64 to be embedded in a resource. This is the name that will be assigned to the file when the file is decoded.

media-type.title: Media Type
media-type.description: Specifies a media type as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) Media Types Registry.

oscal-ap-property.title: Property
oscal-ap-property.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which may be expressed as a list of values.

name.title: Property Name
name.description: A textual label that uniquely identifies a specific attribute, characteristic, or quality of the property's containing object.

uuid.title: Property Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier that can be used to reference this property elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistantly used for a given location across revisions of the document.

ns.title: Property Namespace
ns.description: A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

value.title: Property Value
value.description: Indicates the value of the attribute, characteristic, or quality.

class.title: Property Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's name. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of multiple properties of the same object with the same name and ns.

oscal-ap-link.title: Link
oscal-ap-link.description: A reference to a local or remote resource

href.title: Hypertext Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL reference to a resource.

rel.title: Relation
rel.description: Describes the type of relationship provided by the link. This can be an indicator of the link's purpose.

media-type.title: Media Type
media-type.description: Specifies a media type as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) Media Types Registry.

text.title: Link Text
text.description: A textual label to associate with the link, which may be used for presentation in a tool.

oscal-ap-responsible-party.title: Responsible Party
oscal-ap-responsible-party.description: A reference to a set of organizations or persons that have responsibility for performing a referenced role in the context of the containing object.

oscal-ap-responsible-role.title: Responsible Role
oscal-ap-responsible-role.description: A reference to one or more roles with responsibility for performing a function relative to the containing object.

oscal-ap-hash.title: Hash
oscal-ap-hash.description: A representation of a cryptographic digest generated over a resource using a specified hash algorithm.

algorithm.title: Hash algorithm
algorithm.description: Method by which a hash is derived

oscal-ap-remarks.title: Remarks
oscal-ap-remarks.description: Additional commentary on the containing object.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-published.title: Publication Timestamp
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-published.description: The date and time the document was published. The date-time value must be formatted according to RFC 3339 with full time and time zone included.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-last-modified.title: Last Modified Timestamp
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-last-modified.description: The date and time the document was last modified. The date-time value must be formatted according to RFC 3339 with full time and time zone included.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-version.title: Document Version
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-version.description: A string used to distinguish the current version of the document from other previous (and future) versions.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-oscal-version.title: OSCAL version
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-oscal-version.description: The OSCAL model version the document was authored against.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-email-address.title: Email Address
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-email-address.description: An email address as defined by RFC 5322 Section 3.4.1.

type.title: type flag
type.description: Indicates the type of phone number.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-address.title: Address
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-address.description: A postal address for the location.

city.title: City
city.description: City, town or geographical region for the mailing address.

state.title: State
state.description: State, province or analogous geographical region for mailing address

postal-code.title: Postal Code
postal-code.description: Postal or ZIP code for mailing address

country.title: Country Code
country.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for the mailing address.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-addr-line.title: Address line
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-addr-line.description: A single line of an address.

oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-document-id.title: Document Identifier
oscal-ap-oscal-metadata-document-id.description: A document identifier qualified by an identifier scheme. A document identifier provides a globally unique identifier for a group of documents that are to be treated as different versions of the same document. If this element does not appear, or if the value of this element is empty, the value of "document-id" is equal to the value of the "uuid" flag of the top-level root element.

scheme.title: Document Identification Scheme
scheme.description: Qualifies the kind of document identifier using a URI. If the scheme is not provided the value of the element will be interpreted as a string of characters.

oscal-ap-system-component.title: Component
oscal-ap-system-component.description: A defined component that can be part of an implemented system.

type.title: Component Type
type.description: A category describing the purpose of the component.

title.title: Component Title
title.description: A human readable name for the system component.

description.title: Component Description
description.description: A description of the component, including information about its function.

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.description: A summary of the technological or business purpose of the component.

status.title: Status
status.description: Describes the operational status of the system component.

oscal-ap-protocol.title: Service Protocol Information
oscal-ap-protocol.description: Information about the protocol used to provide a service.

uuid.title: Service Protocol Information Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this service protocol entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

name.title: Protocol Name
name.description: The common name of the protocol, which should be the appropriate "service name" from the IANA Service Name and Transport Protocol Port Number Registry.

title.title: Protocol Title
title.description: A human readable name for the protocol (e.g., Transport Layer Security).

oscal-ap-port-range.title: Port Range
oscal-ap-port-range.description: Where applicable this is the IPv4 port range on which the service operates.

start.title: Start
start.description: Indicates the starting port number in a port range

end.title: End
end.description: Indicates the ending port number in a port range

oscal-ap-system-user.title: System User
oscal-ap-system-user.description: A type of user that interacts with the system based on an associated role.

title.title: User Title
title.description: A name given to the user, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

short-name.title: User Short Name
short-name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the user.

description.title: User Description
description.description: A summary of the user's purpose within the system.

oscal-ap-authorized-privilege.title: Privilege
oscal-ap-authorized-privilege.description: Identifies a specific system privilege held by the user, along with an associated description and/or rationale for the privilege.

title.title: Privilege Title
title.description: A human readable name for the privilege.

description.title: Privilege Description
description.description: A summary of the privilege's purpose within the system.

oscal-ap-function-performed.title: Functions Performed
oscal-ap-function-performed.description: Describes a function performed for a given authorized privilege by this user class.

oscal-ap-inventory-item.title: Inventory Item
oscal-ap-inventory-item.description: A single managed inventory item within the system.

uuid.title: Inventory Item Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A globally unique identifier that can be used to reference this inventory item entry elsewhere in an OSCAL document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given resource across revisions of the document.

description.title: Inventory Item Description
description.description: A summary of the inventory item stating its purpose within the system.

items.title: Implemented Component
items.description: The set of components that are implemented in a given system inventory item.

component-uuid.title: Component Universally Unique Identifier Reference
component-uuid.description: A reference to a component that is implemented as part of an inventory item.

oscal-ap-import-ssp.title: Import System Security Plan
oscal-ap-import-ssp.description: Used by the assessment plan and POA&M to import information about the system.

href.title: System Security Plan Reference
href.description: >A resolvable URL reference to the system security plan for the system being assessed.

oscal-ap-local-objective.title: Assessment-Specific Control Objective
oscal-ap-local-objective.description: A local definition of a control objective for this assessment. Uses catalog syntax for control objective and assessment actions.

control-id.title: Control Identifier Reference
control-id.description: A reference to a control identifier.

description.title: Objective Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this control objective.

oscal-ap-activity.title: Activity
oscal-ap-activity.description: Identifies an assessment or related process that can be performed. In the assessment plan, this is an intended activity which may be associated with an assessment task. In the assessment results, this an activity that was actually performed as part of an assessement.

uuid.title: Assessment Activity Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this assessment activity. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when refering to this information. A UUID should be consistantly used for a given included activity across revisions of the document.

title.title: Included Activity Title
title.description: The title for this included activity.

description.title: Included Activity Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this included activity.

items.title: Action
items.description: Identifies an individual actions, such as test steps or examination procedures.

uuid.title: Action Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this defined action. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when refering to this information. A UUID should be consistantly used for a given test step across revisions of the document.

description.title: Action Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this action.

oscal-ap-task.title: Task
oscal-ap-task.description: Represents a scheduled event or milestone, which may be associated with a series of assessment actions.

description.title: Task Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this task.

timing.title: Event Timing
timing.description: The timing under which the task is intended to occur.

on-date.title: On Date Condition
on-date.description: The task is intended to occur on the specified date.

date.title: On Date Condition
date.description: The task must occur on the specified date.

within-date-range.title: On Date Range Condition
within-date-range.description: The task is intended to occur within the specified date range.

start.title: Start Date Condition
start.description: The task must occur on or after the specified date.

end.title: End Date Condition
end.description: The task must occur on or before the specified date.

at-frequency.title: Frequency Condition
at-frequency.description: The task is intended to occur at the specified frequency.

period.title: Period
period.description: The task must occur after the specified period has elapsed.

unit.title: Time Unit
unit.description: The unit of time for the period.

items.title: Task Dependency
items.description: Used to indicate that a task is dependant on another task.

task-uuid.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier Reference
task-uuid.description: References a unique task by UUID.

items.title: Associated Activity
items.description: Identifies an individual activity to be performed as part of an action.

activity-uuid.title: Activity Universally Unique Identifier Reference
activity-uuid.description: References an activity defined in the list of activities.

oscal-ap-reviewed-controls.title: Reviewed Controls and Control Objectives
oscal-ap-reviewed-controls.description: Identifies the controls being assessed and their control objectives.

description.title: Control Objective Description
description.description: A human-readable description of control objectives.

items.title: Assessed Controls
items.description: Identifies the controls being assessed. In the assessment plan, these are the planned controls. In the assessment results, these are the actual controls, and reflects any changes from the plan.

description.title: Assessed Controls Description
description.description: A human-readable description of in-scope controls specified for assessment.

include-all.title: All
include-all.description: A key word to indicate all.

items.title: Referened Control Objectives
items.description: Identifies the control objectives of the assessment. In the assessment plan, these are the planned objectives. In the assessment results, these are the assessed objectives, and reflects any changes from the plan.

description.title: Control Objectives Description
description.description: A human-readable description of this collection of control objectives.

include-all.title: All
include-all.description: A key word to indicate all.

oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common-select-.title: Select Control
oscal-ap-oscal-assessment-common-select-.description: Used to select a control for inclusion/exclusion based on one or more control identifiers. A set of statement identifiers can be used to target the inclusion/exclusion to only specific control statements providing more granularity over the specific statements that are within the asessment scope.

control-id.title: Control Identifier Reference
control-id.description: A reference to a control identifier.

items.title: Include Specific Statements
items.description: Used to constrain the selection to only specificly identified statements.

oscal-ap-select-objective-by-id.title: Select Objective
oscal-ap-select-objective-by-id.description: Used to select a control objective for inclusion/exclusion based on the control objective's identifier.

oscal-ap-assessment-subject-placeholder.title: Assessment Subject Placeholder
oscal-ap-assessment-subject-placeholder.description: Used when the assessment subjects will be determined as part of one or more other assessment activities. These assessment subjects will be recorded in the assessment results in the assessment log.

uuid.title: Assessment Subject Placeholder Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies a set of assessment subjects that will be identified by a task or an activity that is part of a task.

description.title: Assessment Subject Placeholder Description
description.description: A human-readable description of intent of this assessment subject placeholder.

items.title: Assessment Subject Source
items.description: Assessment subjects will be identified while conducting the referenced activity-instance.

task-uuid.title: Task Universally Unique Identifier
task-uuid.description: Uniquely identifies an assessment activity to be performed as part of the event. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when refering to this information. A UUID should be consistantly used for this schedule across revisions of the document.

oscal-ap-assessment-subject.title: Subject of Assessment
oscal-ap-assessment-subject.description: Identifies system elements being assessed, such as components, inventory items, and locations. In the assessment plan, this identifies a planned assessment subject. In the assessment results this is an actual assessment subject, and reflects any changes from the plan. exactly what will be the focus of this assessment. Any subjects not identified in this way are out-of-scope.

type.title: Subject Type
type.description: Indicates the type of assessment subject, such as a component, inventory, item, location, or party represented by this selection statement.

description.title: Include Subjects Description
description.description: A human-readable description of the collection of subjects being included in this assessment.

include-all.title: All
include-all.description: A key word to indicate all.

oscal-ap-select-subject-by-id.title: Select Assessment Subject
oscal-ap-select-subject-by-id.description: Identifies a set of assessment subjects to include/exclude by UUID.

uuid-ref.title: UUID Reference
uuid-ref.description: A pointer to a component, inventory-item, location, party, user, or resource using it's UUID.

oscal-ap-assessment-assets.title: Assessment Assets
oscal-ap-assessment-assets.description: Identifies the assets used to perform this assessment, such as the assessment team, scanning tools, and assumptions.

items.title: Assessment Platform
items.description: Used to represent the toolset used to perform aspects of the assessment.

title.title: Assessment Platform Title
title.description: The title or name for the assessment platform.

items.title: Uses Component
items.description: The set of components that are used by the assessment platform.

component-uuid.title: Component Universally Unique Identifier Reference
component-uuid.description: A reference to a component that is implemented as part of an inventory item.

oscal-ap-assessment-part.title: Assessment Part
oscal-ap-assessment-part.description: A partition of an assessment plan or results or a child of another part.

uuid.title: Part Identifier
uuid.description: A unique identifier for a specific part instance. This identifier's uniqueness is document scoped and is intended to be consistent for the same part across minor revisions of the document.

name.title: Part Name
name.description: A textual label that uniquely identifies the part's semantic type.

ns.title: Part Namespace
ns.description: A namespace qualifying the part's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

class.title: Part Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the part's name. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of multiple parts of the same control with the same name and ns.

title.title: Part Title
title.description: A name given to the part, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

prose.title: Part Text
prose.description: Permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

oscal-ap-assessment-plan.title: Security Assessment Plan (SAP)
oscal-ap-assessment-plan.description: An assessment plan, such as those provided by a FedRAMP assessor.

uuid.title: Assessment Plan Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: Uniquely identifies this assessment plan. This UUID must be changed each time the content of the plan changes.

local-definitions.title: Local Definitions
local-definitions.description: Used to define data objects that are used in the assessment plan, that do not appear in the referenced SSP.

terms-and-conditions.title: Assessment Plan Terms and Conditions
terms-and-conditions.description: Used to define various terms and conditions under which an assessment, described by the plan, can be performed. Each child part defines a different type of term or condition.
